artist: Artist: Yamamura Kōka (Toyonari); Publisher: Yamamura Kōka Hanga Kankōkai
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: head and shoulders of frowning man, looking up to R; wearing black kimono with floral crests and a red undergarment
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica
portfolio: From Untitled actor series, sometimes called Flowers of the Theatrical World (Rien no hana 梨園の華)
text: Fifth design in a set of twelve. Based on Matsumoto Kōshirō VII (1870-1949) as Hanakawado Sukeroku, in reality Soga Gorō Tokimune, in the scene Miuraya kōshisaki of the play Sukeroku yukari no Edozakura 助六由縁江戸桜　三浦屋格子先 (Sukeroku’s Affinity for Edo Cherry Blossoms), performed at the Imperial Theater, April 1917.
title: Actor Matsumoto Kōshirō VII as Sukeroku
